result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey David Day

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Casey David Day not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-04-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for pre-trial.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Family Dollar
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Casey David Day in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Casey David Day appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 1
Lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
